intro: Crepis huetii, commonly known as Huet's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, basal leaves and numerous yellow flowers arranged in compact clusters. Native to the mountainous regions of Europe, it thrives in rocky and gravelly soils. The plant is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it tolerates cold and harsh environmental conditions. Its delicate appearance and ecological adaptability make it a notable species in its native range.
